title: The Big Cheese
description: A mouse detective just trying to find his way in this crazy, cat filled world.
author: Jerry

passages.content: It was raining. Of course it was raining. I needed some scratch to pay the rent for this dump so old Murphy just had to make sure no one would want to come by with a job.

choices.content: Pour another glass of mouse-whiskey and listen to the rain.
Close up early, the streets are one big rain gutter.

passages.content:
You tilt the bottle over your glass, but there's only a splash before droplets hang from the rim. 

"Figures...", you sigh.

The thunder outside rumbles loudly for a moment, and you think you also heard a knock at the door, but then again, this whole building tends to knock around in a storm.

choices.content: Check to see if anyone is there.
Toss back the last of your whiskey.
Load your revolver, you know, just in case.

entrances.content: It was raining. Of course it was raining. I needed some scratch to pay the rent for this dump so old Murphy just had to make sure no one would want to come by with a job.

choices.content: Pour another glass of mouse-whiskey and listen to the rain.
Close up early, the streets are one big rain gutter.

passages.content: You take a peek out into the hall but it's empty. Feeling foolish you decide to close up anyway and head home.

The thunder outside rumbles loudly for a moment, and you think you also heard a knock at the door, but then again, this whole building tends to knock around in a storm.

choices.content: Pour another glass of mouse-whiskey and listen to the rain.
Close up early, the streets are one big rain gutter.

passages.content: By the time you get home you're soaked. You flop into bed and sleep into next afternoon.

choices.content: Pour another glass of mouse-whiskey and listen to the rain.
Close up early, the streets are one big rain gutter.

passages.content:
You finish off the pinky of cheap bourbon and the sound of the storm helps you drift off to sleep in your chair, hat tipped down over your face, whiskers twitching as lightning strikes.

Cold...cold! Wet! You are shocked backed to consciousness, almost falling out of your chair in the process! Once you regain your composure you realize there are two figures standing on the other side of your desk with grim expressions.

choices.content: Pull off a warning shot.
Play it cooler than the water thrown on your face.
Stand up and give an even grimmer look.

choices.content: Pour another glass of mouse-whiskey and listen to the rain.
Close up early, the streets are one big rain gutter.

entrances.content: You carefully load your revolver with a few stray bullets rolling around your desk drawer, then feel a bit parched.

passages.content: The two figures hit the deck, which gives you enough time to move around the desk and make sure they don't try anything funny.

choices.content: "So what's with trying to drown me?"
"I don't remember putting in for a wakeup call."

passages.content: You nonchalantly spit out some of the water and tip your hat back up out of your face.

choices.content: "That wasn't very nice."
"Got anything harder to drink? I'm all out..."

passages.content: You stand and give your most fearsome expression, but all that gets you is a blackjack across the snout, and a universe of stars.
